revised_title: The Role of Chromogens in Anthocyan Pigment Formation in Plants
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the formation of anthocyan pigments in plants. They discovered that the presence of chromogens in flowers is related to anthocyan pigment formation. The recovery of color in decolorized petals supports the conclusion that anthocyanic pigments arise from the oxidation of chromogens. The study also highlights the role of reducing agents in the loss of color in dehydrated petals.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
